comment: Professor Hewage is now at Spelman College. I had her for Health Issues of African Diaspora & whew. She read right from her powerpoint every class & for tests said to just read these powerpoints but her tests often had curveballs. You'll definitely have to work for an A in her class. Lots of reading, note taking, & studying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I had to read the textbook and review questions to scrape by with an A. She reads straight from the power-point which is a watered down version of the book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Oh boy, get ready to memorize the whole entire textbook. Her lectures are straight off a powerpoint that she'll upload online, red items are probably something to pay attention to. Stick strictly to the book, many of her test questions will be from the review questions at the end of chapters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Hewage is an extremely nice lady, but teaching techniques are pretty terrible. Lectures consist of being read to word for word from a power point. She is very dull throughout her lectures so losing concentration is inevitable. Her office hours are not helpful what so ever. I would not take her for a class that is as challenging as A & P.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you want a professor that does mostly minimal effort and doesn't teach, then Hewage is the one for you. She literally reads her powerpoint word for word, rarely gives real life examples and how it can apply to your field and overall is a emotional vacuum of depression whenever students enter her class. If given the opportunity stay away from her

Going to class became less and less a priority since she literally reads word for word off of the slides (which are available on d2L). Your grade comes from only tests basically, and they're pretty tricky. She'll advise you to study her powerpoints but you really need to read the chapters and take thorough notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: For her lectures she mainly just reads straight off the power points. But its a hard class, you're going to have to go home and read the chapters along with the notes to fully understand everything. She really cares about her students and does not like to see them fail so she tries to curve grades when she can but can only do so much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Anatomy lab is more about the student learning and studying on their own than the professor, so really any prof will be fine. Hewage has a thick accent, but is very nice and gave us everything we needed to succeed. Only complaint is that it took her 2 WEEKS to put in both of my practical grades, which was really irritating.

She is really just one of the most boring lab teachers I've had. She has an accent that is difficult to understand at times. She really just rambles on and isn't very helpful with explaining the material usefully. When you ask her for help she just restates what she's said before and honestly doesn't help at all. Studying is all you can really do.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of my favorite professors. Tried to make the Practicals as easy to understand as possible, but it is anatomy so what can you do. She gives you clear study points and you take it from there. Overall great professor would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Ayesha is fine; it's just a hard lab.  You either know the stuff or you don't.  The main problem I found with her was a language barrier.  She couldn't answer all of my questions, and when she tried, she just restated what she already did in the lecture.  It's just a lot of material that you need to know.  You need to study all semester!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Amazing professor! Anatomy is hard and she does her best to try and help. Some professors only count the 2 practicals as the only grades, but she will add in attendance and some online assignments. As long as you study and go to all the labs you will do fine! Only difficult b/c it is a lab and she can only help so much. Rest is up to you.
